messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bizarre was Re: Re: New and in need of support :)
messages.msgSnippet: ... There are *numerous* posts reporting what Bridget is posting on this list. There was a rather lengthy thread about my difficulty in seeing The Simpsons
messages.messageBody:
On Sat, 26 Jan 2002 09:29:37 -0500, The Mowery Family wrote:
>Double
>triple check the archives and see that it has only
>been random messages about this list.

There are *numerous* posts 'reporting' what Bridget is posting on this list. There was a rather lengthy thread about my difficulty in seeing The Simpsons as educational (I was called an idiot, for one).
If one can wade through all the posts about poop (and I thought babies were the only ones obsessed with their poop!), you will find quite a few references to what is going on here. They are mostly from the same people.
But heck... anybody that is curious can go see for themselves by subbing to the list and reading the archives!
--
Sarah Carothers, puddles@... on 01/26/2002


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: bizarre was Re: Re: New and in need of support :)
messages.msgSnippet: This is crazy.  Absolute nonsense.  I am sure there is a double secret agent email list out there somewhere, but it sure as hail isn t AlwaysLearning.  Double
messages.messageBody:
This is crazy. Absolute nonsense. I am sure there is a double secret agent email list out there somewhere, but it sure as hail isn't AlwaysLearning. Double triple check the archives and see that it has only been random messages about this list. Tell you the truth, I could give a rats patoot if you all chew each other up and spit yourselves onto cast iron - but drop the BS about AlwaysLearning. If you are going to "report" on activities, do so without a spin.

Karen Mowery
a member from WAY back when, who continues to hang around because despite the catfights, namecalling and general crapfest this list can generate, because there are days of enlightenment.


Message: 3
Date: Fri, 25 Jan 2002 23:59:30 -0500
From: Sarah Carothers <puddles@...>
Subject: Re: Re: New and in need of support :)

On Fri, 25 Jan 2002 21:01:42 -0800, Tia Leschke wrote:
>

>this nastiness on
>AlwaysLearning. Here, it always seems like it's
>lurking, ready to jump out
>at any time. I stay here, learning what I can and
>helping whenever I can,
>but I just keep wondering.....why?
>Tia

I guess to keep reporting back about what goes on on this list????? It appears that way (see their archives).
--
Sarah Carothers, puddles@... on 01/25/2002
